basics.name: Tyler May
basics.label: Programmer
basics.summary:
I Live in from Houston. I have earned my degree from the University of Oklahoma. Boomer Sooner! Before attending The Iron Yard, I worked as a Audio Video Technician at Ford AV. I specialized in front end engineering (React) at The Iron Yard. I really enjoy working in HTML, CSS, javascript, and React but am familiar with node.js, mongoDB, SQL, pulling data from API's and building databases.

    My non-work interests range from brewing my own craft beer to watching EPL soccer with my daugther and of course my Sooners on saturdays.

work.summary: I choose the Wed Development Career path at The Iron Yard. It was a full-time, 12 week course with career foucused curriculum that has provided me with a full-stack foundation.
highlights: The first 4 weeks comprised of Front-End Fundamentals. We learned to build basic web sites, basic front-end coding skills, and learned to build web applications
Optimized an algorithm that holds the current world record for Weisman Scores

volunteer.summary: Global movement of free coding clubs for young people.

publications.name: Video compression for 3d media
publications.summary: Innovative middle-out compression algorithm that changes the way we store data.

references.name: Erlich Bachman
references.reference: It is my pleasure to recommend Richard, his performance working as a consultant for Main St. Company proved that he will be a valuable addition to any company.
